Reviews.Title: “Dated, dirty hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MrAnyparktos
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a 4*, to begin with. It is a 3* hotel, that is dated and old. It has not been preserved well (with the exception of the reception are, which apparently is the "mirror" of the hotel and must be good-looking), flaking walls, old furniture, curtain with a hole, bathroom with broken tiles.... and a lot more. Also, VERY NOISY ( my room was on the 5fth floor facing the road and all night-Wednesday night btw- I was hearing the music from a nearby club). Breakfast very poor, but at least tasty. TV old (huge box!!) and full of "snow". Most importantly, it is not clean enough!! I had read other reviews before I booked which talked about a clean hotel and so I decided to stay! Although the room generally was clean, I FOUND 5 DIFFERENT TYPES OF HAIR IN MY BED (below the pillow, on the sheet, on the covers)..... Needless to say, I slept with my clothes!!!!!! Also not confortable bed! The pros are the location (a stone's throw from Istiklal and Taksim), friendly staff willing to help (I had booked a small single room and they updated me to a triple room because I wanted to check in earlier).

Reviews.Title: “good budget option right in Taksim”
Reviews.Author: paparufus
Reviews.Content: Satisfactory hotel for those wanting to be a stone's throw from Taksim square without paying a premium for the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean”
Reviews.Author: Vienna_1200
Reviews.Content: Very Clean and such wonderfully generous and welcoming staff. Very close to Taksim square...Good connectivity to the city center. Stay was good and worth for money. Awesome breakfast.Good Internet connection. Definitely recommend for others. Already suggested for my friends. Will definitely stay here when i come again.

Reviews.Title: “Why do people write such rubbish?”
Reviews.Author: ChrisABirmingham_UK
Reviews.Content: I don't generally fill in Trip Advisor reviews but frankly such a lot of rubbish has been said about this hotel that I felt I had to. True it probably wasn't a 4 star hotel and there are many proper 4 star hotels in the area, but which are considerably more expensive. That being said it had a decent sized room with air conditioning a decent sized bathroom with powerful shower (despite being on the 6th floor) ample breakfast a room safe a mini bar at reasonable prices (Â£1 for a beer, 30p for small bottle of water) comfortable beds a desk and free WiFi perfectly pleasant and polite reception staff who spoke English the ability to get food and drinks 24 hours My colleague found his street facing room a bit noisy but mine at the back was quiet. True it had no view but I didn't go to Istanbul for the view from the hotel room. All in it was a perfectly fine hotel at a fair price in a very convenient area.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Paolo C
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is just perfect, so close to Taxim square. Compared to other hotels of the area, rooms at Varda hotel are offered at reasonable prices. My room was very spacious, clean and quite. Breakfast was ok with a good variety of food. The negative point was the staff, that could not hide boredom resulting quite unfriendly. Recommended for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned: this is hardly three stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gllobe-trotter
Reviews.Content: I really don't like the hotels which pretend to be better than they are. Usually hotel shows one star too much, but in the case of Vardar hotel it's rather two stars. I didn't take my time to read the reviews before booking the room in this hotel - I fought 4 stars should be enough. On arrival, when I've seen the bathroom, my first idea was to move to another hotel. Finally I had no time to organize this. Positive points: convenient location, close to main Istiklal street, the room is fairly clean and sufficiently equipped (as for a three star hotel). Negative points: the bathroom is extremely small, the "shower" is constructed of three walls in the corner with the door and to enter to it you need to jump over toilet pan (see photo). Apparently all the bathrooms are like this, according to hotel's staff. Room equipment is quite old, the picture in the TV is so snowy that you can hardly watch it. The street is very noisy during all the night. Breakfast: six small tables in a very small room without window, a small choice of products, drinks: instant coffee, orange "fluid", ... If you're looking for a budget hotel in a good place then you may stay there, but be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Caution....”
Reviews.Author: tonia t
Reviews.Content: In a city full of polite, friendly people, Vardar somehow manages to employ the grumpiest people around. Stay here only if you don't want any tourist advice - like how to get somewhere. The staff refuses to answer even basic questions or help in any way. However, if you already know your way around this awesome city, stay here. It's clean, the rooms are spacious and the location is extraordinary. One more thing: Don't let them call you a cab to the airport. Get your own. Staff made sure a friend of theirs drove us. He took a roundabout way, costing twice what it should have, and then pretended that one of the bills we gave him was a 5 lira, instead of 50. Avoid the staff at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough but not great”
Reviews.Author: sebbie33
Reviews.Content: I would rate it between average and very good. If I went back to Istanbul I would not mind staying here again. I would describe it as an efficient hotel, nothing is too fancy or new, but most seems to work. I had asked for a quiet room in advance and got one of the inward facing rooms which was indeed very quiet. Ofcourse it has no view but why stay in the room when there is so much to see outside? Location is good for touring the Taksim square area. It's a short walk from the tram. To use this to get to the airport will take you approx 1 1/2 hrs, including 2 changes (easy). As mentioned before service is not done with a big smile, but I did not have any negative experience with it. I liked the breakfast, there was quite some choice. Free wireless worked well. The rooftop terrace is a nice place to sit. Price/quality was good for me.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to get excited about”
Reviews.Author: A_sojournor
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms in a great location and adequate breakfast. Greatest negative is the staff who were in no hurry to be of service never mind helpful. Bring an extension cord if you carry electronic gear as 3 of the 4 outlets did not work. Also a map of the area because the staff does not provide them. They were even reluctant to arrange for a 3:30am cab to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellet Hotel in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: Utku67
Reviews.Content: I would highly reccomend this hotel. It is n the middle of the city and close to virtually every tourist location. Hotel is very clean and the staff is friendly. here is free wi-fi internet connection and an excellnt Turkish breakfast with feta chesse and green and black olives.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: YonyYamathon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. I have stayed in Sultanahmet before and the Taxim area is a far better place to stay. As others have pointed out, this is NOT a 4-star hotel; it might scrape a 3 on a good day but certainly nothing more. It's a bit smelly and grubby but generally pretty clean. The toilet brush in our room was disgusting though. The room was a good size, and was at the back so it was nice and quiet. The breakfast is pretty good but the staff should try cracking a smile occasionally. The same goes for the reception staff, though they were helpful when approached. All things considered, this hotel is in a great location and at the right price I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Puumeli
Reviews.Content: Vardar Palace has 4 stars so at least one could suppose that the hotel has a friendly staff and good service. We stayed there for 5 nights and made the reservation at least 6 months before. We asked a quiet room so they gave us a room in the 5th floor. The window in the room was to the inner shaft of the building. So the main view was bricks... And still the narby disco gave us some tunes in the night. The staff was very tired and bored to all questions we made. Despite of the 4star rating the hotel does not have any kind of restaurant service or a bar. Only the breakfast room. This hotel is not a 4 star accommodation, it should have 2 stars. Vardar Palace is situated in the city center and therefore it has a very central location considering the local life. And that is good. Although the main sights of Istanbul are on the other side of the town. And -by the way- thanks to the cleaner. He gave us a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the heart of Taksim”
Reviews.Author: TroubledAditi
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by both the hotel and the Taksim area, after having spent 4 days in Sultanahmet. Vardar Palace truly looks like an old palace from the inside, yet the rooms are modern and well-equipped. My window was facing a corridor but I knew it when booking. The main shopping street and busy nightlife of Taksim are just a few steps away from the hotel. It's amazing how the streets and restaurants are full of people till the early hours! There is a nice night club called Riddim (Rn'B mostly) very close to the hotel. For self-catering (the hotel rooms have refridgerators), Carrefour is on the same street. The breakfast room of the hotel was very cosy but quite hot (or maybe I was sweating because I was ill during my stay). There is a computer in the lobby for free internet browsing. For great views over Istanbul, go to the rooftop terrace.

Reviews.Title: “It could be better”
Reviews.Author: vrisiida
Reviews.Content: The loccation of hotel was very good the room was clean but it looked old The service was not what we expected the staff was not smilling at all and they were not very helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler70
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my stay, because I was staying 6 nights they offered me a very good deal on price and so close to the main square with loads of restaurants and entertainment to choose from. The breakfast had lots of choices between traditional Turkish fare and basic European of cereal, yogurt, fruit and eggs. The room was on the street side which was noisy until you closed the windows which blocked 90% of the street noise. I would totally stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A clean and comfortable centrally located hotel for exploring Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: Norbury01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel itself is clean and tidy with a friendly service. Rooms are comfortable with the all standard facilities. Breakfast is typical hotel continental breakfast. The hotel can also arrange airport transfers which are good value,compared to local taxis. The Vardar is well located, approximately 5 minutes walk to Taksim Square the main shopping street. All the major tourist/historical sites are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located but average”
Reviews.Author: Amskeatng
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because i wanted something economical around taksim square. It fulfilled both my needs. From the train station/bus station/tram its a 5-7 min walk. Istiklal street is just round the corner, lots of cheap restaurants, grocery stores, money exchange, etc. Its a basic hotel. The hotel terrace has a sit out, which gives you a peek of the bospherous. There is a cozy seating at the reception along with a free internet both. The room was average, clean, with decent room service. From our bathroom, I could hear the TV in the next room. However, the street can get pretty noisy, and the windows when shut don't really block out much noise. Our room faced the road, there isn't much of a view, as there are buildings all along. The breakfast was a wholesome Turkish breakfast - nuts, olives, salad, cheese, meats, eggs, bread, cereal, juice.... phew! that's enough to get u started..

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: LondonAnn
Reviews.Content: I only chose to stay at this hotel as a stop over choice, I needed to be near to Taksim Square for the Airport bus in the morning. Despite being located about 300 metres away, I was charged $20 in a taxi!! When I arrived I was absolutely shocked!! This hotel rates itself as a 4 star but it was no better than a college dorm room. The single room was so small that I did not need to use a remote control from the bed! The room faced a dirty brick wall that let in no light for the whole day. In the bathroom, you could hear the conversations from next doot through the vent. Breakfast was very basic but probably its redeeming feature. The next day, determined not to be duped by another taxi driver, I asked reception to call me a cab and even gave them the money to negotiate the 2 minute journey to Taksim Square (with luggage) as I noticed that the taxi driver's general command of English wasn't so good. They sent the 'bell boy' to do this on my behalf. I was horrifed to learn that when I got to Taksim, no money had changed hands and I had to pay the driver again!! I don't know who to believe - the hotel or taxi driver.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: whiteangel35
Reviews.Content: it was a good hotel with a very polite and nice staff, and it was really clean but the only problem they had is the breakfast which was really poor in which you can only find the primary stuff (cheese, salami, olives, boiled eggs) and as I believe this doesn't suit a 4 star hotel. Other than that there is the fact that is located near Taksim square which made it really good for shopping but extremely noisy especially at night. but the good thing about it is that the staff was extremely cooperative with us and they showed us all the important sites in Istanbul on the map and taught us how to get there and they even taught us how and from where to get the metro... but the only key to let them help you is by asking them politely otherwise you won't get a thing

Reviews.Title: “Very Mediocre Hotel, 2 Star At Best”
Reviews.Author: Josh12345678
Reviews.Content: This is going to be a long review because I have a lot to say about the Vardar "Palace" Hotel and Istanbul for tourists. I don't like to complain all that much but usually when you are motivated to take the time to write a review online, it's because a place was great or not so good. This hotel and city gave me more of the latter feeling like it was all just a huge rip off to a tourist. I flew jn from Kuwait (I'm American working there for several years now) on a 3 day weekend short trip, to see the "sites" and experience the nightlife, picking this hotel because it was near Taskim Square and I read a few reviews that this area was loaded with disco's. OK so that was the plan, the airfare was only around 225 USD roundtrip so I figured I could afford it even if just for 2 1/2 days. First bad news was when I arrived, I flew into Sabiha airport (Jazeera air has great sale prices but I've now twice flown into smaller airports that are far away and you end up paying through the nose in taxi fare). The duty free place since I arrived at 22:00 and wanted some liqour (none in Kuwait), was the first rip off. They put the prices in Euro's and then rip you off on the exchange rate, by the time it was converted to US dollars on my credit card, two fifths of whiskey (one Chevas and one Johnny Red) came out to 120.00 USD on my credit card, not a great start. I think liqour stores are available in town so the duty free store was a mistake to do. Taxi ride to Taskim from Sabiha Airport, I read to make sure they use a meter Taxi, which I did. Cost for a 35 minute ride was 78.00 Turk Lira, then the driver said it was 90.00 Lira to pay for tolls, ok, that kind of hurt but what am I to do? Going back to the airport I was charged 58.00 lira for another meter taxi and no charge for the tolls, I tipped the secong guy but not the first feeling pretty ripped off, I never pay that much for taxi's anywhere I've traveled and I have seen a lot of this planet. Checkin into Vardar "Palace", the sign out front said something like your special place FYI, LOL! Anyway they had my reservation at the desk even though they never replyied to my emails to confirm the room like I asked. They questioned if I wanted a single or double room since I was by myself, I asked for a double so I would not get a closet to sleep in, happy I did that. Checked into a room on the second floor in the back, happy I got that as well. The front has no view and the traffic in the street is very very noisy. Room was clean and bed comfortable. I asked the front desk for an adapter plug so I could run my laptop, no luck on that. I figured that if I offered a tip I could get better service on the plug, the guy who worked at night after I said I'd give him 20 lira to find me a plug came up with a plug, imagine that! Now get this, he says its his personal plug for his cell phone and I could only use it for one hour! I asked him what time he got off and I got it extended till 8 am (its midnight when I got the stupid plug, no big freaking deal to find in the town during the day). So you get my drift that these people are kind of heartless and only out for a quick buck. Food inside this "4 star" rip off is another joke and you know how you can tolerate one bad thing (taxi), then two bad thigs (front desk idiot), but upon waking up for the "breakfast" it really set me off. They only served bread and cold cheap cheese and salami. I asked the staff for some cooked eggs (no meat , mind you just eggs as they had hard boiled eggs there) the manager said cooked eggs are only at the 5 star hotels! I loaded up a plate of cold cuts and cheese and left it on the table uneaten in front of all the other tourists there to show my displeasure, and walked out to McDonalds because I was hungry and didn't want any more Turkish surprises.They do serve cooked eggs at the Turkish McDonlads just not at the Vardar "Palace". Room service is available 24 hours 7 days a week, just drinks though no food, no drink list either so don't even go there or your really asking to be raped. I restocked my mini fridge with beers at the many stores in the street. Taskim has a lot of history, it seemed to be very old, the streets very narrow, I walked around a lot arriving on a Saturday night, went into about a dozen bars, usually one drink minimum for 6 to 10 lira cover charge. The typical "club" was a one story place about the size of a studio apartment in NYC and totally wall to wall people, a real death trip if a fire broke out and you had to walk always to the back through trongs of bodies t get to the bar, it reminded me of when I rode on a Tokyo train they were all that packed. I didn't see many torists, 95% Turks. The only Turks that spoke to me were hustlers in the street (At least 6 to 10 during my stay). They approach you talking in Turkish and ask for a light, as a lead to talk (I was smoking), I usually didnt say anything back but when ever I did, they always said, oh your not Turkish in English. This was ment as come on compliment and then it would be lets go have a beer. I blew them all off, I got bored my second night there and talked some more to see where it would go, it was just a come on to get into some rip off, I never went into a place with them. I did see Turkey, and although I spent 1,000.00 USD total with my airfare, hotel and booze and food and of course the high taxi roundtrip to Sabiha airport, for a 2 1/2 day stay it was a good learning experience, it sure beat the many times higher price I would have paid in airfare from America that I may have done later on in life, no I don't plan on a repeat visit to Turkey, lol. I rate the trip above Cyprus (at least I found some good food, unlike there), but the nightlife was nothing to write home about and the prices and people were expensive and looking to totally rip you off. If your working in the Middle East like me my favorite place has been Bahrain, pretty good value there and a much nicer Hotel with a nighclub, room service, pool and cheaper to boot!. If you really want to see Turkey see it for the history only and go in a pre paid tour only, otherwise buyer beware you will get took. I'm not sure the Vardar was bad as far as Turkish standards go but it was bad as far as WORLD standards go. Oh and of course they got me on the exchange rate checking out taking on another 30.00 USD for my stay then what I was quoted in Euro's on Booking.com. Just grin and bear it and move on. Attached are pics of my "view" and also inside the hotel they are using the lobby downstairs as a storage area for mattresses, also a pic of the 4 or 5 POLICE RIOT buses parked at Taskim square, they were getting ready for something!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but overrated”
Reviews.Author: artttex
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during business trip to Istanbul. First of all, when you book your hotel in Istanbul, think twice what you want to see and what you want to do there. Istanbul is a huuge city, and staying far away from your points of interests coud be a real trouble. Pretty bad public transport, big traffic shufle, and if you use a taxi keep your eyes wide open. This hotel is very close to Taksim square, and major shopping - pedestrian street in Istanbul. When I say shopping, you can find a lot of stores of all kind all around Istanbul, but here I think about some decent, quality, stuff. Fashion and clothes mostly. In this street (about 3 minute walk from hotel) you can find some good fashion stores and boutiques, some antique shops, pattiseries, restaurants, cake shops, etc... Quality wise speaking, similar places with quality goods (besides this street), I only saw in two big shopping malls in other parts of town (about 20-25 taxi drive both). But don't be surprise when you see that quality stuff (from Turkish fashion companies for example), are not that cheap. Now about hotel: Most of the hotels I saw in Istanbul are usually rated as a 4 star. Most of them are not that level. This is small hotel with decent rooms and very good location. Beds are nice, something called good view from the room does'nt exist, (personally I looked to wall of other building from my window.) (see photo of the room and the view). But, I wasn't on holiday, didn't spend a lot of time in the room, and that didn't bother me. What bothered me was pretty bad condition of the bathroom, which was pretty small, with a bath, sink, tiles and other stuff probably from the late 70's. (see the photos of the bathroom). Breakfast was basic as can be (much worse than any 3-star in EU countries). Very small lobby , and despite rated (by God knows who), as a 4 star, this hotel doesn't have bar where you can have a drink or cofee. In mini bar (old, ruined piece of furniture from 70's), only drink was coca-cola and sparkling water, if I remember well (see the photo of the mini bar). Actually, before traveling, I visited their web site, and saw the pics there, and after coming to hotel I tought I made some mistake by telling taxi driver the hotel name. Then I checked again, and yes my friend that's the same hotel you've booked. Yes, hotel web sites and pics there could be misleading, but that's why we are all here to tell the right story. Overall, in Istanbul you can see a lot of interesting stuff, and spend couple amuzing days. Just be aware of taxi drivers (ask for a price before entering in ), don't go to night clubs without some Turkish friends, and whatever you are buying always argue and negotiate about the price. Speaking about hotels (including this one), they are almost always overrated, but on the other hand, they are not expensive neither.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad At All”
Reviews.Author: Rushu
Reviews.Content: Well the vardar palace was really nice and clean, and is a wonderful place to stay if you are looking for the night life that Taxim offers, But its really not for me. My room was facing the street and there was loud music untill all odd hours of the morning. If you don't mid the noise then i would go for it. The doubble rooms are big, but the large singles rooms are not that large, and the bathroom in the single room is the size of an airplane loo. The breakfast is nothing to write home about, and the staff is rather surly.

Reviews.Title: “Good option in Taksim”
Reviews.Author: ggabi
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, friendly and polite staff, very clean,breakfast above average. Main dissadvantage: there are not two rooms with the same surface and layout. For the same price you may get a 35sqm room overlooking the main street or a 10sqm room with no windows.

Reviews.Title: “Not good service in Vardar Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Kindly want to inform you that information that provided in your internet page is not correct. As well as I stayed in the hotel from the 16th till the 20th of November 2005 but didnâ€™t have the free transfer. The personal on the reception were not polite. They told me that I cant get it through my arrival but promise me that it will be for my departure from the hotel. But just when I was asking about this service they just told me that give me room more comfortable and its more expensive. Asked me to made a choose to pay more for the hotel or be without transfer. I think itâ€™s a scandal and it could be like this. They need to pay more attention for the service that provide and check the information that put in webpage. My opinion that the hotel is not good about service and people shouldnâ€™t go there. Its easy to find more comfortable and cheaper hotel in Istanbul with the high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Very Pleasant Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Seasnake
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vardar Palace for a few days in September this year. It was very clean, and the staff were very pleasant and helpful. As Rough Guide will tell you, it can be noisy at night, as it is opposite a nightclub, and very close to Taksim Square, so bear this in mind - they're a lively bunch in this area !!

HotelInfo.Name: Vardar Palace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Syraselviler Caddesi No.16 Taksim, Istanbul 34433, Turkey
